{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3335282,"name":"","username":"elm","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/e/57b2e6/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-03-17T19:18:22.216Z","cooked":"

Hi everyone, we are looking to replace the standard wheels on the am14U5kit bot with Andy Mark blue nitrile treaded wheels. We have seen options to buy “upgrade kits” but we are looking to do it in a more cost and time-efficient way. Does anyone have any suggestions on how we should approach this? Whether it be cutting down the wheel or buying additional parts. If it comes down to buying an upgrade which would be best? Thanks in advance.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":3,"updated_at":"2024-03-17T19:18:22.216Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":83,"readers_count":82,"score":41.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":458996,"topic_slug":"help-replacing-amkitbot-with-6-in-blue-nitrile-treaded-wheels","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65146,"hidden":false,"trust_level":0,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/help-replacing-amkitbot-with-6-in-blue-nitrile-treaded-wheels/458996/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3335289,"name":"Billfred Leverette (he/him/not Bill)","username":"Billfred","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billfred/{size}/225278_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-17T19:31:55.054Z","cooked":"

Some thoughts:

  • If I was spending money on an upgrade kit, I’d get the 8WD HiGrip set. Easier maintenance, eliminates any hazard around the center wheel screws gouging your inner plate (which was more of a concern in 2022 but we’ve seen it a few other years under hard driving), and the robot will be a hair less rocky.
  • It is possible to cut the tread off HiGrip wheels and rivet on your own tread. Used to do it in the 2000s.
  • I would venture that for 90% of teams running an AM14U in 2024, drivetrain upgrades are not the thing holding them back and the resources should be focused in other mechanisms on the robot. (The exception was running six motors on drive, but that was outlawed this year.)
